alert.note: Alert for Adair; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 6:40PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Crawford, northwestern Sebastian, eastern Sequoyah, southeastern Adair and northeastern Le Flore Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 640 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Natural Dam to 2 miles southwest of Van Buren to near Bonanza. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Fort Smith... Van Buren... Poteau... Cedarville... Natural Dam... Alma... Barling... Pocola... Muldrow... Roland... Spiro... Arkoma... Hackett... Bonanza... Cameron... Chester... Moffett... Rudy... Lee Creek... Fort Smith Regional Airport... This includes the following highways, Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 0 and 12. Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 317 and 328. Interstate 540 between mile markers 1 and 14. Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 28, and between mile markers 36 and 39. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
